intro: Spergularia rupicola proles australis, commonly known as the Australian sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that thrives in sandy and rocky soils, often found in coastal dunes and cliff faces. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Spergularia rupicola proles australis plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
